Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with KOMODO_INSYNC it basically skips that validation until your node is in sync. are you 100% sure valid blocks are being rejected?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as far as deadlocks go maybe you are doing a recursive LOCK() on some mutex?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes 100% sure valid block are being rejected

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Guess I'll look at it again today, I have the chain just before a million. Maybe I can print out what blocks are failing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, please. valid blocks shouldnt fail. it indicates a data error

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i had to write that code so it wasnt easy to figure out what it does

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it makes sure that a notary mined block has the notary signed 0.0001 -> 0.00005 tx

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a multipart puzzle

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Ahh I thought it had something to do with that, but wasnt by sure. Will do

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ultimately if a valid block is failing, that means it is not seeing a notary pubkey or getting the wrong scriptPubKey or corrupted coinbase

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just print the various values and it should show why it is failing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: though if it is a timing related thing (blocks processed async being too slow for when it is being used) then adding the printouts could slow it down enough to make it work

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It appears to be a timing thing yes, but will investigate.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
`return(-1 * (komodo_electednotary(&num,script+1,height,0) >= 0) * (height > 1000000));`
I know exactly why its happening but I dont know what the reasoning behind this code is^^^^ multiplies by 1 if the height is over 1 million blocks. Instantly starts failing. It will still sync (but much slower and goes though nearly all of the avalibe peers, unless you keep doing clearbanned).
Disabling this check during sync, lets it sync to the longest chain without any issues.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
Not sure where to put this, but I figure everyone should get to learn from my stupidity.....
Never forget that if you deal with raw transactions and set nlocktime:
sapling opt-out chains (such as OOT) need to use the old format
sapling chains need to use the new format (including nExpiryHeight)
if you use the new format on an opt-out, since signrawtransaction sees the hex as valid, you will have the vins you want but alter the vout and send your funds to the wrong address!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can put LOCK() in an inside loop, so it locks/unlocks many times, the important thing is to not be locking for long periods at a time

Content: It was locking the cs_main for the entire CreateBlockfunction

Content: its wasnt easy to make it release the lock half way down
